items.title: Live: Steve Smith's Sixers to bat first in blockbuster BBL decider
items.description: Steve Smith is in search of a triumphant end to his explosive BBL cameo, with the Sixers and Scorchers locking horns in the competition's final at Perth Stadium.

items.title: Breaking: Search for missing 12yo boy at Victorian beach
items.description: Police and the community have mounted a search for 12-year-old Danny, who was last seen swimming at a beach in Venus Bay on Sunday afternoon.

items.title: Man charged after allegedly sending threatening letter to Sydney mosque
items.description: Police seized more than 100 letters, stamps, notepads and several electronic devices after a raid on the 70-year-old's Belmore home.

items.title: A second person has been shot dead by federal agents in Minneapolis. Here's what we know
items.description: The death of 37-year-old US citizen Alex Pretti has prompted a fierce political debate and further protests in an already tense city. This is what we know about the situation so far.

items.title: WHO chief calls U.S. withdrawal reasons 'untrue,' says exit makes world 'less safe'

featured_image.name: WHO chief Tedros in quarantine after contact gets COVID-19 ...

items.description:
World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Saturday rejected the reasons cited by the United States for its formal withdrawal from the U.N. health agency, calling them "untrue" and warning that the exit "makes both the U.S. and the world less safe."[1][2][3]

The sharp rebuke came two days after Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced the completion of the withdrawal process in a joint statement, marking the first time since the WHO's founding in 1948 that the United States has not been a member.[4][5]

items.title: Dingoes involved in death of Canadian backpacker euthanased
items.description: Queensland government officials euthanase six dingoes involved in the death of a Canadian backpacker on K'gari, with more to be put down in the coming days.

items.title: US envoys meet Netanyahu to discuss Gaza reconstruction plan

featured_image.name: Witkoff and Kushner meet Netanyahu as US seeks to advance ...

items.description:
An anti-Hamas militia operating under Israeli control has claimed responsibility for the assassination of a senior Hamas police chief in Gaza, as US special envoys arrived in Israel on Saturday to discuss the future of the war-torn territory with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

The targeted killing on January 12 by the Popular Forces militia reflects Israel's growing reliance on Palestinian armed groups to combat Hamas in areas it controls, even as the Trump administration pushes forward with its ambitious "Board of Peace" plan to rebuild Gaza.

items.title: Trump advisers meet Netanyahu to advance Gaza ceasefire talks

featured_image.name: Witkoff and Kushner meet Netanyahu as US seeks to advance ...

items.description:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declined a direct White House request for President Isaac Herzog to represent Israel at the inauguration of President Trump's Gaza Board of Peace in Davos, Switzerland, resulting in Israel's notable absence from Thursday's ceremony and exposing tensions between Jerusalem and Washington as Trump's peace initiative advances into its second phase.

The White House extended invitations to 58 nations to join the Board of Peace, with Netanyahu himself receiving an invitation, according to Axios. However, due to an arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court in 2024, Netanyahu could not travel to Switzerland. With Herzog already attending the World Economic Forum, senior U.S. officials twice approached the Prime Minister's Office on Tuesday and Wednesday, proposing that Herzog sit on stage alongside Arab and Muslim leaders and sign the board's charter, according to Israel's Channel 12.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: Police confirm possible sighting of suspected gunman Julian Ingram
items.description: A large-scale search is underway in the Mount Hope district after a possible sighting of the alleged triple murderer overnight.

items.title: Live: Alex de Minaur takes to Rod Laver Arena for Bublik showdown
items.description: Superstars Aryna Sabalenka and Carlos Alcaraz are through to the last eight of the Australian Open, with Australia's Alex de Minaur still to come at Melbourne Park. Follow live.

items.title: Fire threatens homes in Victoria's Otways ahead of possible record heat
items.description: An out-of-control bushfire continues to threaten communities in Victoria's Otways, as heatwave conditions continue in some parts of the state.

items.title: China places two top generals under investigation in major purge

featured_image.name: China's Xi Places His Top General Under Investigation as ...

items.description:
China's highest-level military purge in decades became official on January 24, 2026, when state media confirmed that Zhang Youxia, vice chairman of the Central Military Commission and a member of the ruling Politburo, has been placed under investigation for "serious violations of discipline and law." Liu Zhenli, chief of the Joint Staff Department and a CMC member, is also being investigated, according to an announcement from the Ministry of National Defense.[1][2][3]

The terse statement said the decision to open investigations into both senior military figures followed "deliberation by the Party's central leadership," providing no further details on the alleged violations.[4][5]

items.title: Liberals wait on Hastie-Taylor decision before moving on Ley
items.description: Liberal leadership aspirants Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor are being urged to "sort out" which of them will challenge Sussan Ley for the party's top job before a spill is called.

items.title: Some accept the risk of shark bites. Others quietly wrestle with fear
items.description: As a devoted ocean swimmer, I've learned to accept the risk of exploring an ocean that is not my natural habitat.

items.title: Gold crosses $5,000 per ounce for the first time

featured_image.name: Gold smashes new record of $4,600 as Powell probe and global flashpoints ignite safe-haven rush

items.description:
Gold prices have breached the closely watched $5,000-per-ounce barrier for the first time, capping a historic rally fueled by a weakening U.S. dollar, robust central bank buying, and expectations of further Federal Reserve rate cuts.

As of Saturday, January 24, 2026, spot gold traded at approximately $4,988 per ounce after establishing an intra-day record high above $5,009 earlier in the session. The precious metal has gained roughly 15% since the start of 2026 and nearly 80% compared to a year ago. Silver has been equally buoyant, with prices approaching $100 per ounce after hitting unprecedented highs in recent sessions.[1][2][3][4][5]

items.title: Trump threatens 100% tariffs if Canada proceeds with China deal

featured_image.name: Trump imposes promised tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China ...

items.description:
President Donald Trump on Saturday threatened to impose a 100 percent tariff on all Canadian goods entering the United States if Canada proceeds with its newly signed trade agreement with China, dramatically escalating a week of diplomatic tensions with America's northern neighbor.

"If Governor Carney thinks he is going to make Canada a 'Drop Off Port' for China to send goods and products into the United States, he is sorely mistaken," Trump wrote on Truth Social, referring to Prime Minister Mark Carney. "China will eat Canada alive, completely devour it, including the destruction of their businesses, social fabric, and general way of life."[1][2]

items.title: Chinese scientists achieve 10x boost in CO2-to-starch conversion

featured_image.name: Chinese scientists turn carbon dioxide to starch with 10 ...

items.description:
Researchers at China's Tianjin Institute of Industrial Biotechnology have increased the productivity of their carbon dioxide-to-starch conversion technology by more than tenfold compared to their original 2021 breakthrough, according to a report published Friday by the Chinese Academy of Sciences-run China Science Daily.[1][2][3]

The advance brings scientists closer to industrializing a process that could fundamentally reshape how one of the world's most important carbohydrates is produced, potentially eliminating the need for agricultural cultivation of corn and other starchy crops.

items.title: Methane-eating bacteria could turn pollution into plastics, study finds

featured_image.name: Meet The Microbes That “Eat” Harmful Methane Pollution

items.description:
Bacteria that consume methane could transform one of the planet's most potent greenhouse gases into useful products including biodegradable plastics, animal feed, and cleaner fuels, according to a new scientific review examining rapid advances in methanotroph research.

The study, published this week in the journal Energy & Environment Nexus, positions methane-consuming bacteria as biological "gatekeepers" capable of both reducing climate-warming emissions and converting waste gases into valuable materials.[1][2][3]

items.title: UK-led mission to create artificial eclipses proposed to ESA

featured_image.name: Proposed new mission will create artificial solar eclipses in space

items.description:
An international consortium of scientists has proposed a spacecraft mission to generate artificial solar eclipses in space, offering unprecedented views of the Sun's atmosphere as Earth experiences its most severe solar radiation storm in over two decades.

The Moon-Enabled Sun Occultation Mission, known as Mesom, has been submitted to the European Space Agency for consideration as a future mission. If approved, the mini-satellite would position itself within the Moon's shadow roughly once every 29.6 days, creating total eclipse conditions lasting up to 48 minutes—ten times longer than typical eclipses observed from Earth.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: Pentagon says South Korea will lead North Korea deterrence
items.description:
The Pentagon on Friday unveiled its National Defense Strategy, outlining a fundamental change in how the United States approaches security on the Korean Peninsula: South Korea will now be expected to take the lead in deterring North Korea, with Washington providing "more limited" support.

"South Korea is capable of taking primary responsibility for deterring North Korea with critical but more limited U.S. support," according to the document released Friday evening, as reported by Reuters. "This shift in the balance of responsibility is consistent with America's interest in updating U.S. force posture on the Korean Peninsula."[1][2][3][4]

items.title: President Trump Announces U.S. Military Airstrike in Venezuela
items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.title: Trump Meets Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago for Gaza Ceasefire Phase Two Talks
items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.title: Feds Launch Massive Taxpayer Fraud Probe in Minnesota After Viral Video
items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.title: Americans Express Widespread Opposition to AI Data Centers
items.description: Public backlash against AI infrastructure data centers grows, with protests and demands for bans influencing Democratic Party strategies for future elections[3].

items.description: China prioritizes humanoid robots in tech race with U.S., ramping up production while warning of industry bubble and potential bottlenecks[3].

items.title: Trump-Putin Call Amid Ukraine-Russia Tensions Over Peace Plan
items.description: President Trump spoke with Putin amid ongoing Ukraine conflict, with Russia reevaluating peace plan tenets after Ukrainian denials[1].

items.title: Democratic Gubernatorial Candidates in Wisconsin Focus on Inflation and Trump
items.description: Seven Democrats vying for Wisconsin governor blame economic issues on Trump and emphasize affordability ahead of 2026 primary[3].
